intro: Justicia microdonta, commonly known as the small-leaved flame flower, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant red to orange tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as an annual or perennial herb, often reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. The flowers are clustered in terminal spikes and are pollinated primarily by birds and insects.
